net.sf.mmm.util.date.api

Class WeekdaySet

  • java.lang.Object
    • net.sf.mmm.util.lang.api.AbstractDatatype
      • net.sf.mmm.util.lang.api.AbstractSimpleDatatypeBase<V>
        • net.sf.mmm.util.lang.api.AbstractSimpleDatatype<Integer>
          • net.sf.mmm.util.date.api.WeekdaySet
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    Serializable, AttributeReadValue<Integer>, Datatype, SimpleDatatype<Integer>

    public class WeekdaySet
extends AbstractSimpleDatatype<Integer>
    This Datatype represents a set of Weekdays. It can represent any unordered combination from none to all.
    Since:
    1.0.0
    Author:
    Joerg Hohwiller (hohwille at users.sourceforge.net)
    See Also:
    Serialized Form

    • Field Summary

      Fields 
      Modifier and Type Field and Description
      static WeekdaySet ALL
      An WeekdaySet containing all Weekdays.
      static WeekdaySet NONE
      An empty WeekdaySet containing no Weekday at all.
      private static long serialVersionUID
      UID for serialization.
      private Set<Weekday> set 
      static WeekdaySet WORKDAYS
      An WeekdaySet containing the working days (all but Weekday.SUNDAY and Weekday.SUNDAY).

      • encode

        private static int encode(Weekday... weekdays)
        This method encodes the given set to a bit-mask for getValue().
        Parameters:

        Returns:
        the encoded value.

      • encode

        private static int encode(Set<Weekday> set)
        This method encodes the given set to a bit-mask for getValue().
        Parameters:
        set - is the Set of Weekdays.
        Returns:
        the encoded value.

      • getValue

        public Integer getValue()
        This method returns the WeekdaySet as compressed mask of seven bits. This method returns the raw value of this datatype. This will typically be a standard datatype (like String, Character, Boolean, any type of Number, any type of java.time.LocalDate, etc.).
        Specified by:
        getValue in interface AttributeReadValue<Integer>
        Specified by:
        getValue in interface SimpleDatatype<Integer>
        Overrides:
        getValue in class AbstractSimpleDatatype<Integer>
        Returns:
        the value of this datatype.

      • contains

        public boolean contains(Weekday weekday)
        This method determines if this WeekdaySet contains the given Weekday. This is equivalent to: 
        getSet().contains(weekday)
        Parameters:
        weekday - is the Weekday to check.
        Returns:
        true if the given weekday is contained in this set, false otherwise.

      • getSet

        public Set<Weekday> getSet()
        This method gets an unmodifiable Set representing this WeekdaySet.
        Returns:
        the Set with all Weekdays.

      • getNextMatch

        public Weekday getNextMatch(Weekday weekday)
        This method gets the next Weekday contained in this WeekdaySet starting with the given weekday. If the given weekday is contained, it will be returned. Otherwise the next successor is determined.
        Parameters:
        weekday - is the Weekday to start with.
        Returns:
        the next Weekday starting with the given weekday or null if this WeekdaySet is empty.

      • toString

        public String toString()
        Returns the official String representation of this Datatype. While the general contract of Object.toString() is very weak and mainly used for debugging, the contract here is very strong. The returned String has to be suitable for end-users and official output to any kind of sink.
        ATTENTION:
        This method is not supposed to do internationalization (I18N). See NlsMessage for this purpose and implement NlsObject if you want to support I18N/L10N.
        Specified by:
        toString in interface Datatype
        Overrides:
        toString in class AbstractSimpleDatatypeBase<Integer>
        Returns:
        the official String representation to display the value of this Datatype.

      • invert

        public WeekdaySet invert()
        This method returns a new WeekdaySet that is the inverse selection of this WeekdaySet. Every Weekday contained in this WeekdaySet is NOT contained in the returned result and vice versa.
        Returns:
        the inverse WeekdaySet.
